ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] I lust for more power-
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeow... most of my playing is on the road so I play EQ on a laptop.  And since I have a company provided machine my wife won t let me spend on a gaming
ygData.messageBody:
Yeow... most of my playing is on the road so I play EQ
on a laptop. And since I have a company provided
machine my wife won't let me spend on a "gaming
machine" like I want. So the wife and the kids get
cool machines and I play on a 1.2 GHz, 512 MB RAM, 32
MB video work machine, doh. Forget moving in the
bazaar, leaves on trees bog me down, doh.

Love your nice machines because they surely must
enhance the gaming experience.

Quwi
--- Melanie Johnson <melanie_6602@...> wrote:
> I had the same problem as you. Forever I played EQ
> on
> a Celeron 400, 32 meg vid card and 384 megs of
> memory.
> I recently upgraded to a new machine though. While
> it's hardly top of the line, I feel like I can
> actually move now. It's a celeron 1.7, 64 meg card
> and
> 768 megs of memory.
>
> Hang in there, you'll get your machine one day. :)
>
> Mel
>
> --- mlockridge01 <MLockridge01@...> wrote:
> >
> > Techno-envey and power lust have me big time. I
> > still limp along on a
> > nearly three year old etower 600mh rig with
> limited
> > memory and graphics.
> >
> > To cruise the Bazaar with hardly a hitch. To visit
> > POK and be able to
> > move in a normal fashion. Ah.
> >
>
> >
> > Barto Proudfoot
> >
> >
>
>
> =====
> ~~~~~~~~~
>
> And on the eighth day God said, "O.K. Murphy. You
> take over."
>
